data.prompt:
Extract comprehensive customer insights from reviews about Multi-Function Combination Switches.
The output format is JSON in English:
{
"phy": {
"<PHYSICAL>": {
"<PID>@<DETAIL>": {
"<SENT>": [ID, …]
}
}
},
"perf": {
"<PERF>": {
"<perf_id>@<DETAIL>": {
"<SENT>": {<PERF_REASON>: [ID, …]}
}
}
},
"use": {
"<USE>": {
"<SENT>": {<USE_REASON>: [ID, …]}
}
}
}

Definitions:
- <PID>: Unique ID for physical aspect ("phy"), starting from A. After Z, continue with AA, AB, and so on.
- <PHYSICAL>: Components or inherent physical properties of the Multi-Function Combination Switches without external interaction (e.g. dimensions, appearance, material type...)
- <DETAIL>: A self-contained detail summarized from the reviews.
- <SENT>: Sentiment polarity of the current <DETAIL> (- for negative, + for positive).
- ID: All review IDs mentioning the <DETAIL>
- <perf_id>: Unique ID for performance or functions ("perf"), starting from a. After z, continue with aa, ab, and so on.
- <PERF>: The Multi-Function Combination Switches' performance (e.g. flexibility, durability, ...) or behaviors under various conditions (e.g. temperature, force, chemicals...) without reference to any specific use case
- <PERF_REASON>: <PID> of the <PHYSICAL> explicitly mentioned as the cause of the <PERF>. Include all mentioned <PID>s. If no reason is mentioned, use "?". <PERF_REASON> and <PERF> should have the same sentiment polarity in the review where they are mentioned together (i.e. the same review ID are included at both locations)
- <USE>: The specific application, applicable object, method, tool, or environment for the product.
- <USE_REASON>: <perf_id> or <PID> causing the <USE>'s sentiment. Include all mentioned reasons, or "?" if none can be inferred. <USE_REASON> and <USE> should have the same sentiment polarity in the review where they are mentioned together.

CRITICAL INSTRUCTIONS:
- <PHYSICAL>/<PERF> and <DETAIL> MUST NOT include:
  * Generic statements without details (e.g., "good", "bad quality")
  * Issues unrelated to the product itself (e.g., "fast shipping", "delivery time")
- If a review mentions any physical aspect, related performance, or use together, extract them as separate entries under "phy," "perf," and "use," with no overlap.
- Make sure each <DETAIL> is under the most relevant <PHYSICAL> or <PERF> in the context of Multi-Function Combination Switches
- Preserve negations

Key Instructions:
- Break down reviews with multiple aspects, performances, or uses into individual entries.
- Escape special characters with backslash that could cause JSON syntax errors.
- Include only explicitly mentioned reasons, and use "?" where no reason is mentioned.

Final Checklist:
- Go through all reviews and ensure that no aspect, performance, use, or reason is omitted, even if only mentioned once.
- Review all entries to ensure proper separation between aspects, performances, and uses.

Print the JSON result only.
Input format:
<ID>#<review>

[[INPUT]]
0#Well-made switches at a decent price. This switch works just fine. Well-made. Good value.
1#Im very happy. Good quality and price.
2#Better. Same as store near by but better price and more quality since individually wrapped no scratches or stain
3#Good product. Easy to install
4#Used and didnt work at first. I'm thinking i might have received a Returned item. Had a weird "burnt" plastic (circuit board) smell. Used one and worked fine. Hooked up a bathroom heat/vent/light combo. One switch i hooked up the vent (to one switch) and light (to other switch). Then installed the other switch on my main bathroom light and wired in the heater portion, that way I don't max out the amperage on one circuit. At first the second install, i had put the "line" to the brass screw and the "loads" to the other switch's (heater and light respectively). Turned on the breaker then one on the switch and both the heater and light came on. It baffled me for a good while. I rechecked all my wiring in the gang box and in the attic for the heat/vent/light combo. All wiring was correct. Then i went out to Lowes to buy another, Eaton, hooked it up and i did the same thing. So i decided to read the instructions very carefully. It stated, "to run the single pole double switch as two INDEPENDANTLY switches, break off the copper tab between the two loads!" That was the KEY! i looked on the Eaton switch and this one and sure enough on the load side, there it was. I took my flathead screwdriver, small, and wedged it in per the instructions and a simple up, down, and back up again then the tab broke off. Now it works fine. How i know this was prob a returned item? The first switch i installed, i didn't have to break the load tabs off because someone else did it for me! They work great now after about 2hrs of troubleshooting, climbing up and down from the attic, turning on and off the breakers to switch the line wires around ect...The single pole 3 switch didn't have the break off tab so idk what gives? It's not like this is or was a 2-way switch configuration. But in the end, lesson learned and experience / wisdom was gained.
5#Great Price For Nice Switches. Two of these were cheaper than one equivalent switch at Home Depot or Lowes. Those stores have lost touch with their prices. They work great and aren’t too loud when you use them.
6#Great Value. Bought these because they were a great value compared to big box stores. They worked out great and I will buy again when needed.
7#Exelente. Muy bien todo
8#Just as good as brand name. These work super well, and since they are only doing a small led light, I they they will last a long time
9#THEY WORK. Just recently I installed a TV on my outside porch on the wall. I needed a couple of outlets, HDMI, Ethernet, & maybe a coax. Combining this with a wall plate and there it is. All together, neat and clean fits just right in between the studs. Even my wife likes how it looks. Not an easy feet to do.
10#No instructions. No clear instructions and caused parks no happy
11#amazing product very well designed. amazing product very well designed
12#PERFECT Good Quality product. I obviously needed two switches to go into a single gang box (reason for purchasing). Good quality product and the switches rock easily and feel sturdy, unlike other off brand named products. Feel confident purchasing this brand
13#Good product low price. Great price, product is good !
14#Amazon shipping is an issue. I ordered this one gang dual switch instead of two gang since the original installation of two gang switch had a issue of not had enough space due to iron studs so that part of the face plate was under the door frame. It looks so ugly and I decided to repair it with this one gang dual switch. The two gang box was removed and one gang after work switch box was installed successfully. However, I waited more than a week with the wires open live for this dual switch. The dual switch price is very good but the switch has never arrived and I reordered today. There is a negative feedback on the switch on or off position not known but it is on the same bathroom and it is on or off is obvious that I do not care.
15#Switch position. The switch Pontianak flip to new position is so light you do not realize the switch is on or off. Would have prefer a stiffer switch where it clicks into position. For the price it is a good value.
16#Good quality switches. These work well and fit correctly. They seem as good as the ones sold under better known brands at local stores. I have no idea how durable they will be, but so far they are working well for me.
17#Well-designed dual rockers, but non-standard coloring. These dual-rocker switches are easy to install in a decora-style face plate, offering simple push-to-flip operation. My only real complaint is about the color coding of the terminals. Anyone who has done electrical for years knows that the green screw is ground, the brass screw is hot, and the silver screw is load/neutral. These units eschew this convention entirely, using black for hot and brass for load/neutral and ground. This is only a problem if you start wiring up the brass side and THEN get to the other side and find out you have to start over. Luckily, they are well-labelled (in English anyway). There is also a pre-installed jumper plate on the common/hot side, so that you don't have to wire the power in separately if the two loads are on the same circuit. (If they are not, a quick flick of a screwdriver or pliers can remove the tab.) The low cost makes it a worthwhile purchase, though.
18#Great price for two. These are well made and work perfectly. The price I paid for two was less than I had been paying for one. If needed I would buy again.
19#Do Non come with a cover. Do Non come with a cover you need to buy separately
